contents.text: Cobby and the Game of Cowball
Do you want to know what's going to happen next?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text: Cobby the little cow moved with Mommy Cow to the island of Hippolandia.

But Cobby is not happy.

"I don't like moving to a new island," says Cobby.

Mommy Cow says, "Sometimes, I get sad about leaving the old island, too, but I will be with you every time you are feeling upset."

"And, when you are feeling upset you can always play your favorite game of Cowball."

The land of Hippolandia is warm and green and filled with many creatures of all different shapes and sizes. Cobby likes his new house and his neighbors too.

There is just one problem. The kids in Hippolandia don't play Cowball. They play Hippominton.
Cobby can't play Hippominton very well because he doesn't know how to jump high. He tries and tries to jump as high as he can, but he just can't jump high enough to hit the Hippominton ball.
"I don't like this game because I don't know how to jump high," says Cobby.

Arthur, the Alpaca, says to Cobby, "Hey, I couldn't jump very high when I began playing Hippominton. But now I can jump better."

"Think about the good feelings you have when you jump.

"So no matter how high or low you jumps, you will always feel good"

Other kids start to jump. Some kids bounce really high, other kids don't jump very high.

Cobby says to himself, "Think about the good feelings you have while you jump."

He leaps up high and notices that his body feels great when he jumps.
Cobby lands on the ground. Arthur, Bella, and Elena cheered! Cobby did not jump very high. But it felt good anyway!
Can you tell me a story about when you didn't want to exercise because you were scared you were not good enough?
contents.subtext: Exercise is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, or swimming.

contents.text: Instead of focusing on what scares you, what are some good things you can think about when you are doing that activity?
Trying new things can makes us feel uncomfortable. But that feeling will often fade away. Itâ€™s helpful to think about the things that make an activity enjoyable when you start being active.

Chapter 2 

 Searching for a Cowball
Do you think Cobby can play his favorite game of Cowball soon?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text: Cobby has new friends. His new friends play Hippominton every day. Cobby misses playing Cowball because it is still his favorite game.

"Mommy, I want to play Cowball but nobody has the ball on this island," said Cobby.

"Oh I know what I can do," says Mommy Cow.

"Tomorrow is Saturday. First thing in the morning we ask our neighbors where we can get the ball for Cowball game," she says.

In the morning, Mommy and Cobby go to Ms. Kamal the Cat.

Ms. Kamal  has no idea what a Cowball is. "All I have are big balls of threads," says Ms. Kamal. "But let me take you to Mr. Jose. He might be able to help you."So Cobby, Mommy, and Ms. Kamal go to Mr. Jose's house.

"I have no idea what a Cowball is. I have tall boxes, but no balls," says Mr. Jose.

Then he says, "Let me take you to Dr. Evelyn, she might be able to help you."

So Cobby, Mommy, Ms. Kamal, and Mr. Jose go to Dr. Evelyn's house.
"I know what a Cowball is, but I don't have any," said Dr. Evelyn. "I have a smaller ball that you can use," she says. Dr. Evelyn shows Cobby the small ball.

"Thank you, Dr. Evelyn. But this ball is too small for a game of Cowball."

Dr. Evelyn says, "I know it's not as big. But playing with a small Cowball is better than not playing at all."

"Yes. And you can teach us how to play Cowball," says Mr. Jose.

That afternoon, Dr. Evelyn, Mommy Cow, and Cobby teach Mr. Jose and Ms. Kamal how to play Cowball.

It was a small Cowball, but it was fun nonetheless.
Can you tell me a story when a friend or a relative helped you to be active?
contents.subtext: Being active means doing any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing on the playground, or playing sports like baseball or soccer.

contents.text: How could this person help you to be active in the future?
There are times when we can't do everything by ourselves. It's good to ask others for help sometimes.

Chapter 3 

 Teaching Cowball
Do you think Cobby will play the game of Cowball with his friends?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text: Now that Cobby has a small Cowball he wants to teach his friends how to play the game. On Sunday afternoon, Cobby stops by Arthur's house to take him for a Cowball game with Bella and Dionne.

Cobby began to explain the game rules. "So to play Cowball..., you have to kick the ball and run. Then you kick the ball from this pole to that pole. Let me show you how," says Cobby.

Cobbie kicks the ball and runs and kicks and runs from one pole to the another. "Now its your turn, Bella," says Cobby.
Bella kicks the ball and runs then kicks the ball and runs. She finishes faster than Cobby!

"Arthur, it's your turn," says Bella.

Arthur kicks the ball. Then he runs. Then he stumbles. He kicks the ball again and tries to run to catch the ball. But Arthur is not a very fast runner. "I can't do this. I'm exhausted," says Arthur.
""Let me try," says Elena. She kicks the ball and runs as fast as she can. Like Arthur, she can't catch the ball. She falls of to the ground instead.

"I'm exhausted! Let me take a break," said Elena.

"Nobody wants to play Cowball," says Cobby.

"Nooo, that's not what we said," says Arthur.

Elena says, "Yes. This is a fun game. But we need a break."

"Let's do this again next Saturday," says Bella.

"Yeah, let's do this again next Saturday!" says Arthur.

In the evening, Cobbie has dinner with his mom, brothers, and sisters.

"You smiled a lot tonight. Did you have a good time with your friends?" Mommy Cow asks.

"Yes! We are going to play Cowball again next Saturday."
Can you describe a fun sports game or exercise activity that you can do with your family this week?
contents.subtext: Activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath. For example, running, playing in the park, dancing, swimming.

contents.text: What is fun about doing this sport or exercise activity together?
Making a commitment to do an enjoyable activity as a family is a great way to be healthy and also have some fun!

Chapter 4 

 A New Game
Do you think Cobby's friends can play Cowball better this time?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
It's Saturday morning. Cobby and his friends are practicing Cowball again.

Bella kicks the ball to one poll, runs to catch the ball, kicks the ball to the other poll, and runs again. She can run very fast.
Arthur and Elena can't run very fast. They can't run as fast as Bella. "Cobby, I think the game isn't very  fun. Elena and I can't run very fast," says Arthur.

Bella says, "Cobbie can play Hippominton with us!"

"But he doesn't like it very much because he doesn't think he can jump very high," said Arthur.

"Why don't you just play Cowminton?" says Mr. Jose who is standing nearby.

"What is Cowminton?" Cobby asks.

"Cowminton is like Cowball, but not really. It's also like Hippominton, but not really," Mr. Jose explains.

"Ultimately, it's part Cowball and part Hippominton," says Mr. Jose to the kids.

"To play this game, one of you must run very fast and kick the ball from this pole to that pole. Then your teammate should grab the ball and throw it higher than the pole"

Cobby kicks the ball from one pole while Elena waits by the other pole. Cobby kicks the ball again for Elena to catch.

Elena catches the ball then jumps very high. She throws the ball towards the other pole. The ball flew above the pole. Way higher.

"Elena, that is so cool!" says Bella.
"This is a cool game. Let's play this again. Bella, we're a team okay?" says Arthur.

The kids of Hippolandia now play the game of Cowminton every day.

Cobby is happy. Every day he can run faster and jump much higher. Cobbyâ€™s Mom is also happy that Cobby is happy.

This new game makes everyone happy and healthy.
At the end of the story, Cobby plays a different game because being active with his friends and family makes him happy What kind of family physical activity that makes you happy?
contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like speed walking, riding a bike, or hiking.

contents.text: Why that family activities makes you happy?
Being physically active together makes you healthy and you get more time to be together with your family.
